caption:
This photograph captures a historical reenactment scene outdoors, likely reflecting a period gathering or festival. In the foreground, a woman dressed in 19th-century attire—including a dark dress with green and gold trim, a light blue apron, and a black bonnet—sits on the grass engrossed in reading a book. She gestures with one hand while holding the book in the other, and around her are various period-appropriate accessories like a white pillow and additional fabrics.

In the background, several other reenactors in period costumes interact and prepare their attire. To the left, garments are draped over a clothesline, hinting at the makeshift camp-like setting. Among these individuals, a woman adjusts her dress, a man in white pants and shirt sits nearby, and another person in a blue bonnet and white apron strolls in their midst.

Additionally, on the right, a young boy, dressed in striped contemporary casual clothing, plays in the grass, drawing a contrast between the historical theme and modern participation. The setting seems to be a grassy area surrounded by trees, establishing a peaceful, picnic-like atmosphere at a historical event.
title: Old time Rifleman's meet, June 24, 1973, is held on the Greenfield Village green adjoining the Henry Ford Museum of Dearborn. Red coats identify the "British army contingent" at the match.
